TextLang.Text: Press the %e button to save settings.
The print operation will be performed with the settings shown below.
Do you want to cancel the print operation?
The printer has not been selected. Go to [Settings] > [Printer Settings] > [Printer Selection] and select a printer.
You can check the status of, or cancel, background print jobs under [Settings] > [Printer Settings].
A communication error has occurred with the printer. Check that the printer is connected and that the power is turned on.
The print operation could not be started. Check the printer.
The printer has become disconnected. The print operation will be cancelled.
The printer cover is open. Check the printer.
An ink cartridge error has occurred. Insert the ink cartridge correctly. For more information, refer to the instruction manual for the printer.
Change the ink cartridge. For instructions on changing the cartridge, refer to the instruction manual for the printer.
A paper jam has occurred. Refer to the instruction manual for the printer and remove the paper.
The paper is not set correctly. Set the paper correctly. For more information, refer to the instruction manual for the printer.
The tray is not set correctly. Set the tray correctly. For more information, refer to the instruction manual for the printer.
A paper feed error has occurred. Set the paper again. For more information, refer to the instruction manual for the printer.
An error has occurred with the printer. Check the printer.
An error has occurred with the printer battery. Check the printer.
The printer output tray is closed. Check the printer.
Cancelling the print job... Please wait.
This operation cannot be performed while printing.
The print operation could not be completed.
The maximum number of copies that can be printed at one time is %1.
Check the message displayed on the printer.
Check that the printer is connected and that the power is turned on.
Select a printer to use. Connect a printer that is compatible with the PS3™ system and turn on the power.
No printers compatible with the PS3™ system were found. Check that the printer is connected and that the power is turned on.
Do you want to cancel? The settings you have made so far will not be saved if you cancel.
